treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Cynareae;genus Cirsium;species remotifolium;variety remotifolium;
treatment.description: Phyllaries imbricate or often subequal, narrowly oblong or linear, entire or sometimes weakly expanded and scarious. Corollas cream-colored, 20–28 mm, tubes 6–12 mm, throats 8–10 mm, lobes 4.5–6.5 mm.

habitat_info.text: fields , meadows , forest openings , open woods , brushy slopes ;

treatment.discussion: Variety remotifolium occurs primarily west of the Cascade Range in Washington and Oregon and on coastal-facing slopes in northwestern California. Intermediates with var. odontolepis are known through much of that range.
